cosmic_conquistadors

Class Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • cosmic_conquistadors.Config

  • public class Config
extends java.lang.Object
    The Config class provides a way to save user settings to the hard drive and read it again when the program is restarted. It uses very simple syntax and supports strings, integers and decimal numbers as well as comments.

    An example of a config file could be: 

    
 # settings.cfg
 myString = "This is a string value"
 myInt = 10
 myDouble = 3.14

    To read the config file: 

    
 Config myConfig = Config("settings.cfg");

 String myString = myConfig.getString("myString");
 // myString = "This is a string value"

 int myInt = myConfig.getInt("myInt");
 // myInt = 10

 double myDouble = myConfig.getDouble("myDouble");
 // myDouble = 3.14
    Author:
    Rikus Honey
    See Also:
    Cosmic Conquistadors
